qas.question: How many times was the palace bombed in WWII?
Which monarchs were in residence at Buckingham Palace during WWII?

answers.text: King George VI and Queen Elizabeth

qas.question: The bombing of Buckingham Palace showed what to the public?

answers.text: the common suffering of rich and poor

qas.question: What was destroyed in one of the bombing that hit the palace in WWII?
The King and Queen were filmed doing what after a bombing?
The royal family was seen as sharing what with their subjects after the bombings?
How many times was the palace remodeled in WWII?

plausible_answers.text: King George VI and Queen Elizabeth

qas.question: Which monarchs were missing from Buckingham Palace during WWII?
What did the royal family never share with their subjects after the bombings?

plausible_answers.text: the common suffering of rich and poor

qas.question: What was hidden from the public as a result of the bombing of Buckingham Palace?

context: During World War II, the palace was bombed <a0_0><b7_0>nine times<b7_0/><a0_0/>, the most serious and publicised of which resulted in the destruction of <a1_0><b8_0>the palace chapel<b8_0/><a1_0/> in 1940. Coverage of this event was played in cinemas all over the UK to show <a3_0><b11_0>the common suffering of rich and poor<b11_0/><a3_0/>. One bomb fell in the palace quadrangle while <a2_0><b9_0>King George VI and Queen Elizabeth<b9_0/><a2_0/> were in residence, and many windows were blown in and <a4_0>the chapel<a4_0/> destroyed. War-time coverage of such incidents was severely restricted, however. The King and Queen were filmed <a5_0>inspecting their bombed home<a5_0/>, the smiling Queen, as always, immaculately dressed in a hat and matching coat seemingly unbothered by the damage around her. It was at this time the Queen famously declared: "I'm glad we have been bombed. Now I can look the East End in the face". The royal family were seen as sharing <a6_0><b10_0>their subjects' hardship<b10_0/><a6_0/>, as The Sunday Graphic reported:
